paper_title: K4Nb6O17/Fe3N/α-Fe2O3/C3N4 as an enhanced visible light-driven quaternary photocatalyst for acetamiprid photodegradation, CO2 reduction, and cancer cells treatment

paragraphs.paragraph_text: A new magnetic quaternary photocatalyst, K 4 Nb 6 O 17 /-Fe 2 O 3 /Fe 3 N/g-C 3 N 4 , was synthesized via a simple onestep thermal pyrolysis process.The prepared photocatalyst was well characterized, and its photocatalytic activity was evaluated towards acetamiprid pesticide degradation, CO 2 reduction reaction, and U87-MG cell eradication.The coexistence of four different crystalline structures in the prepared photocatalyst could simultaneously facilitate photoelectron transport and suppress charge recombination through their coupled heterogeneous interfaces.Because of the coexistence of various photosensitive compounds, the prepared photocatalyst showed the excellent capability to harvest the visible light photons despite its calculated high-bandgap of 2.75 eV.Besides, the magnetic saturation of about 12 emu/g facilitated the photocatalyst reusability.Benefiting from these favorable properties, the quaternary photocatalyst exhibited 76 removal efficiency for the degradation of acetamiprid pesticide after five times repeated cycles.The evolution rate of 7.01 and 1.3 mol g -1 h -1 was estimated for CO and CH 4, respectively.According to the morphological properties of the treated cells with the IC50 concentration, adecrease of about 50 of viability was observed.Ultimately, the mechanism of charge transfer was comprehensively discussed by quenching experiments and spin-trapping ESR.

annotations.answer: K 4 Nb 6 O 17 /-Fe 2 O 3 /Fe 3 N/g-C 3 N 4
annotations.source: A new magnetic quaternary photocatalyst, K 4 Nb 6 O 17 /-Fe 2 O 3 /Fe 3 N/g-C 3 N 4 , was synthesized via a simple onestep thermal pyrolysis process.

Because of the coexistence of various photosensitive compounds, the prepared photocatalyst showed the excellent capability to harvest the visible light photons despite its calculated high-bandgap of 2.75 eV.

paragraphs.paragraph_text: The Niobium pentoxide powder (Nb 2 O 5 , 99.0) was supplied from Shanghai Macklin Biochemical Co., Ltd.Melamine (C 3 H 6 N 6 , 99.0) and potassium hexacyanoferrate (K 3 Fe(CN) 6 , 99.0) were bought from Sinopharm Chemical Reagent Co., Ltd.DMEM medium culture, penicillin, phosphate-buffered saline (PBS), trypsin/EDTA and streptomycin were provided by Gibco (Germany).MTT (3-(4, 5-dimethylthiazol-2-yl)-2, 5-diphenyltetrazolium bromide), and dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO) were purchased from Sigma-Aldrich (Munich, Germany).All the reagents mentioned above were used without further purification.Deionized water (specific resistance: 18.2 Mcm) was also used during the preparation steps, wherever needed. Nb 2 O 5 (2.65 g), melamine (1.26 g), and K 3 Fe(CN) 6 (1.9 g) were precisely mixed with a molar ratio of 1:1:1.5 and ground in a vessel for 20 min.The obtained yellowish precipitate was then poured into the aluminum crucible and placed in a muffle furnace, which its temperature was raised to 550 C with a rate of 2 C/min.The sample was kept h at this temperature and then was cooled down to room temperature with the same ramping rate.Finally, the soft black obtained powder was repeatedly washed with ethanol and distilled water to remove any unreacted remnant of the precursors. The morphology and structure of as-synthesized photocatalyst were characterized by Field Emission Scanning Electron Microscopy (FESEM, XL30 model coupled with the EDX system), Transmission Electron Microscopy (TEM, FEI Tecnai G2 f20 s-twin with an acceleration voltage of 200 kV).The crystal phase of the as-prepared photocatalyst was identified by X-ray diffraction (Bruker D8 Advance diffractometer with Cu K radiation, 0.15406 nm).X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (a Shimadzu-Amics instrument with aluminum Ka radiation) was performed to estimate the as-prepared photocatalyst compositions.FT-IR spectra in the range of 4000-400 cm -1 were recorded on a Bruker Vertex 70 spectrophotometer.The Raman spectrum of the sample was recorded on Dispersive Raman microscopy with a 785 nm laser.UV-visible diffuse reflectance spectra were recorded on a UV-visible spectrophotometer (Shimadzu Solidspec-3700 DUV), using BaSO 4 as the reference standard.The photocatalyst magnetization properties were measured on a TOEI VSM-5 vibrating sample magnetometer (VSM) at 300 K. Electron paramagnetic resonance (EPR) was performed on a Bruker E500 instrument at 100 K equipped with an Oxford cryostat performing under the X-band.The photocurrent analysis was performed using Biologic Potentiostat/Galvanostat (Biologic SP-240)) operated with a custom three-electrode system composed of the working electrode (1 1 cm 2 ), Pt wire (auxiliary electrode), and Ag/AgCl reference electrode. Photocatalytic degradation of Acetamiprid (AP) was conducted in a Pyrex reactor surrounded by a cooling water stream to maintain the medium temperature at 28 C. The irradiation source was a 300 W xenon lamp with a light intensity of 0.220 W cm -2 and a 420 nm cut-off filter.Typically, 20 mg of the photocatalyst was poured into 60 mL of the AP aqueous solution with an initial concentration of 50 ppm.Samples (ca.mL) were withdrawn for UV-vis analysis at regular time intervals and centrifuged for 10 min at the rate of 15,000 rpm.The target content was determined using a UV-vis spectrophotometer (GBC Cintra 40) adjusted in AP max at 245 nm. CO 2 catalytic photoreduction in the presence of H 2 O was performed in a Pyrex reactor under a 300 W xenon lamp equipped with a 420 nm cut-off filter, which provided the light intensity of 0.220 W cm -2 .The circulating water flow kept the temperature around 25 C.An online gas chromatography system witha TCD detector was connected to the photoreactor to assess the photoreaction yield and find methane and carbon monoxide percentage. U87-MG human GBM cancer cell line was supplied from the National Cell Bank of Iran (NCBI).The cellgrowth medium was DMEM fulfilled with fetal bovine serum (10), penicillin (100 units/ml), and streptomycin (100 g/ml) and preservedin a humidified incubator with 5 CO 2 at 37 C. Penicillin was added to decrease the probability of microbial pollution in the cell culture, while FBS was used as the cancer cells' nutrient source.The cell confluence should be over 90 before any photocatalytic treatments, and it can be checked with an inverted microscope at a 10 objective magnification. A kind of cytotoxicity assays has been used to detect the effect of the photocatalyst on U87-MG cancer cells.As a reliable cytotoxicity assay, cell viability was evaluated using 5-diphenyltetrazolium bromide (MTT), and 3-(4, 5-dimethylthiazol-2-yl)-2 based on the previous method described elsewhere 35.The U87-MG cells were seeded at 7 103 cells/well in a 96 well plate in DMEM medium (containing penicillin (100 unitsml), FBS (10), and streptomycin (100 gml)) and incubated under humidity with 5 of CO 2 at 37 C for overnight.In the following, to permitcell sticking to the photocatalyst, DMEM in each well was substituted with fresh medium containing different concentrations (0.5, 1, and 2 mg/ml) of the photocatalyst and incubated for 15-90 min.Afterward, 20 L of MTT (5 mg/ml in PBS) was poured into each well, and the contents were then incubated for 4 h at 37 C.After incubation, the purple-colored formazan crystals were dissolved by adding 100 L of DMSO to each well.After 20 min, to determining IC50 values, the optical density was measured at 570 nm using an ELISA microplate reader.Cell viability was calculated as a percentage using the following equation: 100 All the tests were performed in triplicates to avoid any experimental error. The intracellular ROS generation using U87-MG cells were detected by DHE staining of Cayman ROS detection cell-based assay kit (DHE).U87-MG cells were seeded in 96-well plates and treated with (1 mg/ml) of the photocatalyst and incubated for 45 min.After this time, the cells were rinsed with 1 cold PBS and stained with DHE (5 m) in dark conditions for 30 min.Also, N-Acetylcysteine and Antimycin-A were used as negative and positive controls, respectively.Finally, the ROS level was evaluated by a fluorescence microscope (Cytation5 cell imaging multi-mode reader).The assay was performed based on the welldescribed method and in triplicates 36.

annotations.source: The morphology and structure of as-synthesized photocatalyst were characterized by Field Emission Scanning Electron Microscopy (FESEM, XL30 model coupled with the EDX system), Transmission Electron Microscopy (TEM, FEI Tecnai G2 f20 s-twin with an acceleration voltage of 200 kV).
The crystal phase of the as-prepared photocatalyst was identified by X-ray diffraction (Bruker D8 Advance diffractometer with Cu K radiation, 0.15406 nm).
X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (a Shimadzu-Amics instrument with aluminum Ka radiation) was performed to estimate the as-prepared photocatalyst compositions.
Typically, 20 mg of the photocatalyst was poured into 60 mL of the AP aqueous solution with an initial concentration of 50 ppm.
A kind of cytotoxicity assays has been used to detect the effect of the photocatalyst on U87-MG cancer cells.

In the following, to permitcell sticking to the photocatalyst, DMEM in each well was substituted with fresh medium containing different concentrations (0.5, 1, and 2 mg/ml) of the photocatalyst and incubated for 15-90 min.
U87-MG cells were seeded in 96-well plates and treated with (1 mg/ml) of the photocatalyst and incubated for 45 min.
UV-visible diffuse reflectance spectra were recorded on a UV-visible spectrophotometer (Shimadzu Solidspec-3700 DUV), using BaSO 4 as the reference standard.
The irradiation source was a 300 W xenon lamp with a light intensity of 0.220 W cm -2 and a 420 nm cut-off filter.

CO 2 catalytic photoreduction in the presence of H 2 O was performed in a Pyrex reactor under a 300 W xenon lamp equipped with a 420 nm cut-off filter, which provided the light intensity of 0.220 W cm -2 .
Photocatalytic degradation of Acetamiprid (AP) was conducted in a Pyrex reactor surrounded by a cooling water stream to maintain the medium temperature at 28 C.

paragraphs.paragraph_text: The new magnetic K 4 Nb 6 O 17 /-Fe 2 O 3 /Fe 3 N/g-C 3 N 4 photocatalyst was fabricated by a simple one-step thermal pyrolysis method.The results obtained from different characterization techniques confirmed the successful formation of quaternary crystalline phases.According to DRS and VSM, the optical bandgap and magnetic saturation were evaluated to be 2.75 eV and 12 emu/g, respectively, which implied that the reusable quaternary photocatalyst was able to harvest the visible light photons quickly.The recycling experiments indicated that K 4 Nb 6 O 17 / -Fe 2 O 3 /Fe 3 N/g-C 3 N 4 removed 76 of acetamiprid after five consecutive runs.The charge carriers transfer in the junctions was investigated through the quenching experiments and spin-trapping EPR analysis.The obtained results from the quenching experiments and spin-trapping EPR analysis demonstrated that OH radicals are the most efficient photoactive agents for promoting the AP photodegradation.The evolution rates of 7.01 and 1.3 mol g -1 h -1 over K 4 Nb 6 O 17 /-Fe 2 O 3 /Fe 3 N/g-C 3 N 4 under irradiation were achieved for CO and CH 4 respectively, nearly 14.6 higher than that of over g-C 3 N 4 .The anti-proliferative effect of the photocatalyst was evaluated in human GBM cancer cells at different times and concentrations.The obtained results confirmed that the photocatalyst had sufficient efficacy to eradicate U87-MG cells under visible light.Overall, the obtained results implied that the prepared quaternary photocatalyst could be favorable for wastewater remediation and energy production processes. Fig.1.(a) SEM images of quaternary photocatalyst, (b) EDS mapping of Nedodium, Carbon, Oxygen, Nitrogen, Iron and Potassium, (c) TEM imagesof the prepared quaternary photocatalyst. Fig. 3. XPS spectra of quaternary K 4 Nb 6 O 17 /-Fe 2 O 3 /Fe 3 N/C 3 N 4 photocatalyst: (a) total spectrum, (b) Nb 3d, (c) O 1s, (d) Fe 2p (e) C 1s, and (f) N 1s spectra. Photo Energy(eV) K 4 Nb 6 O 17 /-Fe 2 O 3 /Fe 3 N/g-C 3 N 4 photocatalytic performance.The photo-electochemical (PEC) performance of the K 4 Nb 6 O 17 /-Fe 2 O 3 / Fe 3 N/g-C 3 N 4 and pure g-C 3 N 4 was shown in Fig. 5f.The greater photocurrent for K 4 Nb 6 O 17 /-Fe 2 O 3 /Fe 3 N/g-C 3 N 4 implies the higher generation rate of photoinduced e -/h pairs in prepared photocatalysts. Fig. 5. (a) The UV-vis absorption spectra of AP during the photocatalytic degradation over K 4 Nb 6 O 17 /-Fe 2 O 3 /Fe 3 N/g-C 3 N 4 , (b) Pseudo firstorder kinetics fitting model of the photoreaction in the presence of K 4 Nb 6 O 17 /-Fe 2 O 3 /Fe 3 N/C 3 N 4 and pristine C 3 N 4, (c) The results of recycling tests, (d) the photodegradation efficiency under different conditions, (Operational parameters: catalyst dosage: 0.02 g, AP concentration: 20 ppm, pH 6-7, temperature: 301 K), (f) photoreduction curves of the K 4 Nb 6 O 17 /-Fe 2 O 3 /Fe 3 N/g-C 3 N 4 andg-C 3 N 4 in (1 M) Na 2 SO 4 solution. Fig. 6.(a) The results of quenching experiments, (b) spin-trapping ESR for DMPO- OH over K 4 Nb 6 O 17 /-Fe 2 O 3 /Fe 3 N/C 3 N 4 under visible light illumination. 2 O 3 and K 4 Nb 6 O 17 , while accumulated holes on the VB of hematite can partially convert H 2 O to OH (due to the near VB potential of Fe 2 O 3 and OH/H 2 O redox reaction).Considering the junction between g-C 3 N 4 and K 4 Nb 6 O 17 via Fe 2 O 3 and Fe 3 N reaches us to the same situation as explained for interfacial junction.If the charge carriers are transferred based on the S-scheme mechanism (Fig. 3b), the Fe 3 N component acts asa charge transfer pathway to make the S-scheme system of K 4 Nb 6 O 17 /-Fe 2 O 3 /g-C 3 N 4 64.Through this pathway, Fe 3 N with metallic transfer nature could significantly decrease the e/h recombination rate in K 4 Nb 6 O 17 and stabilize the charge carriers to preserve on the g-C 3 N 4 conduction band and K 4 Nb 6 O 17 valence band, respectively.The positions of CB and VB in the g-C 3 N 4 with a work function of 4.5 eV are higher than -Fe 2 O 3 with a higher work function (5.4-6 eV)65.When these two semiconductors are in contact witheach other, electrons in CB of the g-C 3 N 4 diffuse to -Fe 2 O 3 , causing electron depletion and accumulation layersin the interface of g-C 3 N 4 and -Fe 2 O 3 , respectively resulting in the negative interfacial charge on -Fe 2 O 3 and positive charge g-C 3 N 4 .This leads to an upward and downward shift of-Fe 2 O 3 and g-C 3 N 4 Fermi levels, respectively, and aligned in the same level 65.The band bending stimulates the recombination of photogenerated electrons in the CB of -Fe 2 O 3 and holes in the VB of g-C 3 N 4 at the interface region.The photogenerated electrons in the CB of -Fe 2 O 3 and holes in the VB of g-C 3 N 4 recombine at the interface under the Coulombic attraction between holes and electrons.On the other hand, the photogenerated electrons in CB of K 4 Nb 6 O 17 will transfer to VB of -Fe 2 O 3 via the Fe 3 N component and recombine with holes.Therefore, recombination eliminates useless electrons and holes.In contrast, the powerful photogenerated electrons in the CB of g-C 3 N 4 and the holes in the VB of K Fig. 8.The results of CO 2 photoreduction experiments over K 4 Nb 6 O 17 / -Fe 2 O 3 /Fe 3 N/g-C 3 N 4 (I), P25 (II), and g-C 3 N 4 (III). COOH ads e - CB CO ads OH - Fig. 9.The results of the photocatalytic treatment of U87-MG cancer cells.(a) Anti-proliferative effect of the photocatalyst on human GBM cancer cells.Results are mentioned as mean SD, ns: non-significant, P 0.05, and P 0.01 are significant.Each point represents 3 times, each triplicate.(b) and (c) The morphological state of untreated and treated cells with the IC50 concentration. Fig. 10.The statistical results (a) and the microscopy images of the cancer cells stained with DHE, Control sample (b), Negative control (c), Positive control (d) Photocatalytic treated cells (e); Photocatalyst dosage: 1 mg/ml, Treatment time: 45 min, The green fluorescence intensity of the treated cells is comparable with the control sample. 4 Nb 6 O 17 are stable and accessible for hydroxyl production O 2 /O 2 and OH/H 2 O redox reaction, respectively 66.Consequently, OH reactive species degrade the AP molecules, while direct oxidation of AP molecules could occur via the photogenerated holes in the K 4 Nb 6 O 17 VB 4.The obtained results for CO 2 photoreduction experiments over K 4 Nb 6 O 17 /-Fe 2 O 3 /Fe 3 N/C 3 N 4 CO ads e - CB CO -ads (14) CO -ads 2H 2e - CB CH ads OH - (15) CH ads 3H 3e - CB CH ads 4 The authors would like to thank Shaanxi University of Science and Technology, China, for the financial supports of this work.Also, the authors appreciate further supports made by the University of Maragheh, Iran. The authors declare that they have no known competing financial interests or personal relationships that could have appeared to influence the work reported in this paper.

annotations.answer: K 4 Nb 6 O 17 /-Fe 2 O 3 /Fe 3 N/g-C 3 N 4
annotations.source: The new magnetic K 4 Nb 6 O 17 /-Fe 2 O 3 /Fe 3 N/g-C 3 N 4 photocatalyst was fabricated by a simple one-step thermal pyrolysis method.
The obtained results confirmed that the photocatalyst had sufficient efficacy to eradicate U87-MG cells under visible light.
